instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good‚Äù and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message: Hi guys working on an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> air board, as we all know all rails are present green light on charger. Only rail i'm not sure about is PP5V S4RS3 which has 0v i tested for shorts on s0 rails and all are fine. What else could i check to solve this issue ?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is being generated by the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> circuit, but only if <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> is high. <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.

Voltages of <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="smiba, post: 26728"]<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL> is being generated by the <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> circuit, but only if <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> is high. <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL> comes from <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.

Voltages of <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>?[/QUOTE]

Here is what i got simba thanks for your assistance <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> 0V <SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.395 <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL> 3.423

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message: If you check pin 2 on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is it 0v steady or 0v for 3 seconds then up to 1-3v later and back down?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message: As Louis asked, is the 5V bus pulsing? Was the liquid damage? PPVRTC present?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="larossmann, post: 26738"]If you check pin 2 on <CHIP>U7501</CHIP> is it 0v steady or 0v for 3 seconds then up to 1-3v later and back down?[/QUOTE]
whats good big bro yes pin is steady 0v not pulsing

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 26747"]As Louis asked, is the 5V bus pulsing? Was the liquid damage? PPVRTC present?[/QUOTE]

Hey Duke 5v bus is steady no liquid damage clean as a Whistle PPVRTC is 0v charger plugged in. Is that normal in an s5 state?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message: PPVRTC must be present. Check for short to GND then check <CHIP>U1900</CHIP> for corrosion.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power i can't get this shit to work need some help please.
threads.message: Ok guys mark this one as solved, i was fucking trolled by the charger here is why. So i was using a magesafe 1 charger with the magsafe 2 adapter piece apple sells for some reason on the 2015 boards this causes a glitch where the logic board won't turn on, this has has happened to me on a same identical board in the past and i could not figure out why. I used my magsafe 2 from my retina mac and bam it was turned on like a fuking hore, i was pissed all that time wasted for a freaking charger issue i have learned my lesson "USE THE RIGHT CHARGER TO TEST YOUR LOGIC BOARDS".
